title: 111_hr4424
content: The "Enhancing Renewable Energy Investment Act" increases the energy credit for geothermal power equipment and extends grants for specified energy property in lieu of credit. The amendments apply to property placed in service after the enactment date of the Act. The Act extends grants for specified energy property in lieu of credit if the property is placed in service before the credit termination date. Additionally, it introduces a new section regarding nonqualified deferred compensation from certain tax indifferent parties. The Act introduces a new section on nonqualified deferred compensation from tax indifferent parties, stating that any deferred compensation under such a plan shall be taxable when there is no risk of forfeiture. The Act introduces a new section on nonqualified deferred compensation from tax indifferent parties, stating that any deferred compensation under such a plan shall be taxable when there is no risk of forfeiture. Income not subject to foreign income tax and exempt organizations are included in gross income when determinable, with an increase in tax for the taxable year. The new section on nonqualified deferred compensation from tax indifferent parties states that deferred compensation becomes taxable when there is no risk of forfeiture. Interest is calculated at the underpayment rate plus 1 percentage point on underpayments if the deferred compensation had been included in gross income in the first taxable year. Compensation is subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture if it is conditioned on future performance of services. An exception is made for compensation based on gain from an investment asset, which is treated as subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture until the date of disposition. The term 'investment asset' refers to a single asset acquired by an investment fund, where the entity does not actively manage the asset or entity activities. The term 'comprehensive foreign income tax' refers to the income tax of a foreign country applicable to a foreign person eligible for benefits under a comprehensive income tax treaty with the United States. The term 'nonqualified deferred compensation plan' includes plans providing compensation based on equity units' value appreciation. Payment must be received within 12 months after the taxable year to avoid being treated as deferred compensation. The term 'nonqualified deferred compensation plan' includes plans providing compensation based on equity units' value appreciation. Payment must be received within 12 months after the taxable year to avoid being treated as deferred compensation. Regulations will be prescribed by the Secretary regarding the application of rules for certain compensation with respect to effectively connected income. The Secretary will prescribe regulations to carry out the purposes of this section, including disregarding a substantial risk of forfeiture when necessary. A conforming amendment is made to Section 26(b)(2) of the Code, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. The amendments made by this section apply to nonqualified deferred compensation from tax indifferent parties for services performed after December 31, 2008. Amounts deferred before January 1, 2009, not included in gross income before 2018, will be included in gross income in the last taxable year before 2018 or the year with no deferral. The Secretary will issue guidance allowing nonqualified deferred compensation arrangements from services before December 31, 2008, to be amended to comply with income inclusion requirements. The guidance allows nonqualified deferred compensation arrangements to be amended for income inclusion requirements, without being considered a material modification under section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
